title: CTFL Mock Exam
description: This exam simulates the Certified Tester Foundation Level (CTFL) certification exam, covering key software testing principles and practices.

questions.question: Which testing principle states that testing can only show the presence of defects, not their absence?
questions.correctAnswer: R Testing can only show the presence of defects, not their absence.
wrongOptions: Testing proves that the software is error-free.

questions.question: R Which test level is primarily concerned with the evaluation of individual modules or components?
What is the primary purpose of integration testing?
questions.correctAnswer: R To verify the interaction between integrated components.
wrongOptions: To check the syntax of the code.
To assess the performance of the complete system.
To validate individual modules in isolation.

questions.question: Which testing technique derives test cases from the system's requirements without knowledge of its internal workings?
In test management, what is a 'test plan'?
questions.correctAnswer: R A document that outlines the strategy, scope, and objectives of testing.
wrongOptions: A checklist of bugs to be fixed.
A detailed record of test results.
A list of executed test cases.

questions.question: What does 'risk-based testing' imply?
questions.correctAnswer: R Prioritizing tests based on the risk of failure and its impact on the project.
wrongOptions: Randomly selecting test cases without prioritization.
Testing all components equally regardless of risk.

questions.question: Which benefit is most associated with test automation?
questions.correctAnswer: R Increased test efficiency and repeatability.
wrongOptions: Reduced need for test planning and design.

questions.question: What is a common challenge encountered in performance testing?
questions.correctAnswer: R Simulating realistic user load conditions.
wrongOptions: Integrating performance tests with unit tests seamlessly.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT considered a type of non-functional testing?
What is the main purpose of a test summary report?
questions.correctAnswer: R To provide a comprehensive overview of the testing activities and results.
wrongOptions: To list every defect found during testing.
To document each individual test case in detail.
To provide a detailed project plan for future releases.
